newsitem.title: URUGUAY: SOCCER-URUGUAY SUFFER ANOTHER WORLD CUP BLOW.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-URUGUAY SUFFER ANOTHER WORLD CUP BLOW.

text.p: Twice world champions Uruguay suffered another blow in their World Cup qualifying campaign when they dropped two more home points in a 1-1 draw with Colombia on Sunday.

The result was a huge relief for Colombia who began the day second in the table but with three consecutive defeats behind them in the competition. Colombia have 18 points from 11 games, five behind group leaders Paraguay.
Uruguay, who have 14 points from 11 games, have already been held at home by Argentina and beaten by Paraguay. They play three of their remaining five games away.
Dario Silva gave Uruguay, backed by a boisterous 50,000 crowd, an ideal start when he scored in the seventh minute with a shot which went in off the post.
Uruguay played well for the first half hour, putting together some neat attacking moves, but faded badly as the game went on.

Hamilton Ricard, substituting the suspended Faustino Asprilla, equalised two minutes after halftime in one of Colombia's rare attacks. The Colombian defence grew in confidence after the goal and Uruguay ran out of attacking ideas.
